channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cafes Can’t Play Music, but the Water Taps Work: Life Under Syria’s Rebels
item.description: The Islamists who now lead Syria have ruled the city of Idlib for years. Residents say they imposed some strict laws, but also heeded some complaints ...

item.title: What North Korea Gains By Sending Troops to Fight For Russia
item.description: Sending troops to fight against Ukraine has gotten North Korea much-needed cash and diplomatic leverage. But there may be hidden costs, too.

item.title: High on Hope, Wall St. Hears What It Wants From Trump
item.description: Investors and executives are often emphasizing what they like in the president-elect’s agenda, while dismissing what they don’t as mere posturing.

item.title: U.K. faces diplomatic headache with China as President Xi turns up the heat on $327 million plan for lavish new London embassy

item.title: Russia’s chemical weapons chief killed in Moscow blast

item.title: The world’s busiest airline routes in 2024 are largely in Asia
item.description: The Hong Kong to Taipei route is once again the world’s busiest international flight route—a title it last claimed in 2019.
